text: Bill Kahan Kapri (born Dieuson Octave on June 11, 1997), better known by his stage name Kodak Black, is an American rapper. == Early life == Kodak Black was born Dieuson Octave on June 11, 1997, in Pompano Beach, Florida. He is the son of Haitian immigrant Marcelene Octave. His stage name combines the first name of the photo company Kodak and Lil' Black, which was another name Octave used. == Career == Black first became known with the single "No Flockin", released in 2014. His first studio album, Painting Pictures (2017), went onto the US Billboard 200 at number three. It included the Billboard Hot 100 top 10 single "Tunnel Vision". Black's second album, Dying to Live (2018), went to number one on the Billboard 200. Its single "Zeze" (featuring Travis Scott and Offset) went onto the Hot 100 at number two. He released his third album, Bill Israel (2020), while incarcerated. His fourth album, Back for Everything, followed in 2022. Back for Everything contains the hit single "Super Gremlin" as a bonus track. == Personal life == On May 2, 2018, Black legally changed his name from "Dieuson Octave" to "Bill Kahan Kapri". ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1997 births Category:Living people Category:21st-century American rappers Category:21st-century American singer-songwriters Category:African-American rappers Category:African-American singers Category:21st-century American criminals Category:American hip hop singers Category:American people convicted of assault Category:American people convicted of drug offenses Category:American prisoners Category:Atlantic Records artists Category:Black Hebrew Israelite people Category:Gangsta rappers Category:Haitian musicians Category:People convicted of making false statements Category:People from Pompano Beach, Florida Category:Prisoners and detainees of the United States federal government Category:Rappers from Florida Category:Recipients of American presidential pardons Category:Singer- songwriters from Florida
title: Kodak Black
